message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving statistical machine translation performance using discriminative translation models. The paper proposes a novel extension of this work using target context information. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category of Computer Science (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques to improve translation quality, which suggests that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of large training data sizes, which suggests that it could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the analysis of morphological coherence, which suggests that it could also belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category.
